description: Number of edges in 6-partite Turán graph of order n.
comments: Apart from the initial term this is the elliptic troublemaker sequence R_n(1,6) (also sequence R_n(5,6)) in the notation of Stange (see Table 1, p.16). For other elliptic troublemaker sequences R_n(a,b) see the cross references below. - _Peter Bala_, Aug 12 2013
references: Graham et al., Handbook of Combinatorics, Vol. 2, p. 1234.
links: K. E. Stange, Integral points on elliptic curves and explicit valuations of division polynomials arXiv:1108.3051v3 [math.NT]
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Turán Graph [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 30 2009]
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (2,-1,0,0,0,1,-2,1).
crossrefs: Elliptic troublemaker sequences: A007590 (= R_n(2,4)), A030511 (= R_n(2,6) = R_n(4,6)), A184535 (= R_n(2,5) = R_n(3,5)).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
